alert.note: Alert for Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Dripping Springs; Fountain Hills, East Mesa; Globe, Miami; Mazatzal Mountains; Pinal, Superstition Mountains; Rio Verde, Salt River; San Carlos; Southeast Gila County; Superior; Tonto Basin (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 13 at 1:03AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of south central Arizona, including the following areas, Apache Junction/Gold Canyon, Dripping Springs, Fountain Hills/East Mesa, Globe/Miami, Mazatzal Mountains, Pinal/Superstition Mountains, Rio Verde/Salt River, San Carlos, Southeast Gila County, Superior and Tonto Basin. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST early this morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of normally dry washes, streets, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Unbridged crossings may be flooded * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and thunderstorms tonight will be capable of producing flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. When encountering a flooded roadway, Turn Around, Don`t Drown. When encountering a flooded roadway, Turn Around, Don`t Drown.
